name: 2014 "Beyond Words" Fantasy Author Calendar
description: Award-winning photographer Lauren Zurchin has created a fantasy photography calendar with fourteen world-famous authors: Holly Black, Gail Carriger, Cassandra Clare, Tessa Gratton, Lauren Kate, Gregory Maguire, Brandon Mull, Lauren Oliver, Christopher Paolini, Patrick Rothfuss, Brandon Sanderson, Maggie Stiefvater, Tad Williams, and Brenna Yovanoff. Each month features a photograph of a different author (or authors, in one case) dressed in custom costumes made by Lauren, and placed in unique locations with one-of-a-kind props. The overall effect is sometimes dark, sometimes ethereal, sometimes whimsical, and completely fantasy. Proceeds will go to two charities: First Book and Worldbuilders. Curious to find out more about the calendar and the causes? Watch this video to learn about the project in the authors' own words. If you’re interested in purchasing more than one of this item, we encourage you to check out our Combination Pack for discounted rates! Can't decide between this calendar and the 2014 Worldbuilders and Heifer International calendar? You don't have to! You can find them together in a combination pack as well!

name: 2014 Calendar Combination Pack
description: Can't decide between the beautiful and educational charity calendar and the calendar filled with fantasy authors in fantastic settings? You don't have to! Paired here for your pleasure (and at a discount!), you can get multiples of the same calendar, one of each, or two of one and one of the other... Pay attention to your drop-down menu options when adding to your cart! You can find more information about the individual calendars, or buy them individually, here: -2014 Worldbuilders and Heifer International Calendar -2014 "Beyond Words" Fantasy Author Calendar Proceeds from the calendars will go to Worldbuilders and First Book.

name: 2014 Worldbuilders and Heifer International Calendar
description: Hear the inspirational stories of individuals, families, and communities that directly benefit from projects sponsored by Heifer International. This 12" x 12" 13-month calendar, which runs from December 2013 to December 2014, was compiled by the Worldbuilders team with the blessing and aid of Heifer International, and features heartwarming photos from Heifer’s team of professional field photographers. A different country is featured each month, focusing on the real stories of specific families and communities involved in ongoing Heifer programs. Each story showcases the hard work of the participants, their pride in their accomplishments, and their optimism for the future. Learn about and experience each family’s and community's transformation through full-color photos and a map that pinpoints the featured country. Below the fold you’ll find stories written by Heifer International’s World Ark writers and edited by New York Times Bestselling fantasy author Patrick Rothfuss, founder of the Worldbuilders charity. The calendar has a clean design that makes it easy to record events or take notes. Each month features various facts and elaborations about the featured country. Major Christian, Jewish, Muslim and Pagan holidays are represented, as are moon phases. Holiday dates and moon phases are based on Coordinated Universal Time (new GMT standard). If you’re interested in purchasing more than one of this item, we encourage you to check out our Combination Pack for discounted rates! Can't decide between this calendar and the 2014 "Beyond Words" Fantasy Author Calendar? You don't have to! You can find them together in a combination pack as well! Proceeds from the sale of this calendar will go to Heifer International.

name: Chocolate Frogs
description:
Fair Trade Chocolate Frogs from our friends at the Harry Potter Alliance.

Available in milk or dark chocolate, each box includes 3 frogs and a wizard trading card.

Silky. Smooth. Creamy. Froggy. Fair trade. Social justice has never tasted this good!

name: Greysdale Mead T-shirt
description: Any musician knows better than to turn down a drink. A savvy musician knows better than to get drunk in the middle of a gig. That's why a truly clever musician orders Greysdale Mead. Instead of a drink, the barman gives the musician water, and a note is made in a discreet ledger. Later on, the musician can cash out his house credit. (After the barman takes his cut, of course.) Show yourself off as a clever musician in this heather grey t-shirt. Available in Men's and Women's sizes. A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Prime Book Bundle B
description: The lovely folks at Prime have sent us a lot of books for our fundraiser. A ton of books. Hundreds. So many books that we're having trouble finding places to put them all. We've got novels and anthologies and collections. We've got books by authors like Philip K. Dick and Elizabeth Bear. We've got anthologies featuring the greats like Neil Gaiman, George Martin, Holly Black, Cherie Priest, and Ursula K. LeGuin. So we're going to try something new. Mixed book bundles. We're going to package up a bunch of these lovely Prime books, then sell them to you at a huge discount. If you buy the $30 bundle, it will contain over $150 worth of books. This $50 bundle has over $300 worth of books. What's more, none of the books will overlap. So if you buy both bundles, we promise you won't get any duplicates. We're not guaranteeing more than 50 of these bundles, so you might want to jump on them fast. When they're gone, they're gone.... Friends, we do our best to keep shipping costs as low as possible for all our customers, but this book bundle is going to be expensive to ship internationally because it's nearly 20 pounds of books. Please bear with us! All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Eolian Talent Pipe Earrings (Pair)
description:
Badali Jewelry and Patrick Rothfuss collaborated to replicate the talent pipes awarded to talented musicians at the Eolian. These pipes are made of sterling silver, and are available in plain silver or with black antiquing.

This pair of earrings comes in a nifty little black box and with a card of authenticity.

Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Eolian Talent Pipe Earring (Single)
description:
Badali Jewelry and Patrick Rothfuss collaborated to replicate the talent pipes awarded to talented musicians at the Eolian. Pipes are made of sterling silver, and are available in plain silver or with black antiquing.

Comes in a nifty little black box and with a card of authenticity.

Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: 14k White Gold Eolian Talent Pipe Earrings (Pair)
description:
Badali Jewelry and Patrick Rothfuss collaborated to replicate the talent pipes awarded to talented musicians at the Eolian.

These pipes are made of 14 karat white gold, and are available in a plain silver or with black antiquing.

This pair of earrings comes in a nifty little black box and with a card of authenticity.

Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Stabilized Amboyna Burl Wood Ring
description: This ring made of stabilized Amboyna Burl wood was handcrafted by Japheth of Trinkets and Tinkering. Lustrous brown and strawberry-orange loops and swirls hold this alluring wood grain captive. It comes in a faux leather ring box. What does stabilized mean, you ask? Japheth says that "all wood is naturally unstable when cut; it will shrink, crack, twist, and some other quite nasty things. Sometimes just letting the wood dry out on its own can be enough to stabilize it. But when you're dealing with burls, or punky or spalted wood, you want a little more assurance. Stabilizing is a process where vacuum pressure is used to suck acrylic resin into a wood, basically plasticizing the wood so that it can be worked without fear. This acrylic can be dyed to pretty much any color a person likes, producing a plethora of options, and this is why there's a slight color difference between rings." These rings are subject to varied wood grain and color. Unfortunately, we are unable to take requests for specific colors (e.g. lighter or darker). Please be forewarned that submersion in water (via the washing machine, hand-washing dishes, etc.) will weaken the integrity of your ring and may cause it to break. Discover more amazing work by this talented artist on his Facebook page. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: 2014 "Year of the Poser" Calendar
description: Behold the glory of the 2014 Year of the Poser Calendar, 12 months of gender-swapped Science Fiction & Fantasy cover poses by Jim. C. Hines. Supporting the Aicardi Syndrome Foundation, each calendar is autographed by award-winning authors Jim Hines and Patrick Rothfuss. This (very) unique calendar features cover poses from Hines, as well as appearances from special guest authors Patrick Rothfuss, John Scalzi, Mary Robinette Kowal, and Charlie Stross. What inspired this inscrutable project, you may ask? In 2012, Jim wanted to start a discussion about science fiction and fantasy cover art, particularly the ways women were portrayed. To do this, he attempted to contort himself into the poses of various cover art heroines, leading to many discussions about sexism and objectification, the purpose of cover art, and who could do the better Christmas-themed cover pose, Jim Hines or John Scalzi. (Spoiler: it was totally Jim!) Toward the end of the year, Jim launched another round of poses, this time to raise money for the Aicardi Syndrome Foundation. He offered rewards for various fundraising goals, including a cover pose calendar if the fundraiser brought in more than $15,000. Jim figured that was an absurdly high goal, and that he’d be safe. He figured wrong... and thus a calendar was born! Want to learn more? Visit www.jimchines.com/cover-posing for project related blogs, links, and special bonus poses!

name: Dragon Whisperer
description:
A fast-paced family card game designed by the acclaimed Richard Borg that explores a vibrant fantasy world created by Albino Dragon.  Journey through a rich and dynamic universe as you overcome trial quests set forth by the Dragon Whisperers of the seven Havens. 

You'll collect treasure and defeat monsters as you compete with your fellow players to become the next Dragon Whisperer. 

A trick-taking game with a twist, Dragon Whisperer is easy to pick up yet engaging enough to keep players of all levels entertained.

Players: 3-6
Age: 10+
Length: 30-40 minutes

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Unfettered, edited by Shawn Speakman
description: When author Shawn Speakman was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s lymphoma, the writing community banded together to help raise money for medical expenses by making the super awesome fantasy anthology, Unfettered. Unfettered is full of promising and legendary names in the fantasy genre. All of the Unfettered authors donated their work to help raise awareness and money for this successful campaign. And since Pat and Shawn are pals, we asked if a limited quantity of Unfettered could also be sold in the Tinker’s Packs to support our own charity, Worldbuilders. Two great causes, one amazing anthology. Check this list of stellar authors: Terry Brooks Patrick Rothfuss Naomi Novik Brandon Sanderson RA Salvatore Tad Williams Jacqueline Carey Daniel Abraham Peter V. Brett Robert VS Redick Peter Orullian Todd Lockwood Carrie Vaughn Blake Charlton Kevin Hearne Mark Lawrence David Anthony Durham Jennifer Bosworth Lev Grossman Michael J. Sullivan Eldon Thompson Shawn Speakman Unfettered is available signed by Pat or unsigned (see drop-down menu options). Sorry, no personalizations for this item. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders with Shawn’s blessing.

options.name: Slightly Bruised First Edition - Signed by Pat

name: The Name of the Wind - US Edition
description: Hardcover copy of the Name of the Wind. You can get a signed book; a signed book with one of Pat's favorite quotes; or a signed book with a brief personalization. Please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. We do have some copies that are slightly bruised from their journey to us, and they're listed here at a reduced rate. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: The Wise Man's Fear - US Edition
description: Signed, later edition hardcover copy of Wise Man's Fear. You can get a signed book; a signed book with one of Pat's favorite quotes; or a signed book with a brief personalization. Please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. We do have some copies that are slightly bruised from their journey to us, and they're listed here at a reduced rate. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: The Adventures of the Princess and Mr. Whiffle: The Thing Beneath the Bed (Book 1)
description:
Hardcover copies of the first book in Patrick Rothfuss's twisted not-for-kids picture-book series.

Patrick Rothfuss describes this book as "a dark twist on the classic children's picture-book. I think of it as Calvin and Hobbes meets Coraline, with some Edward Gorey mixed in." 

From the San Francisco Book Review: 

“In what is by far the funniest and most original book of the year (so far), Rothfuss shows off his ability to think and create outside of the expected. The story is pure comic genius that will be fun and funny for parents and children. The illustrations, not to be outdone, offer subtle little quirks that, after reading the book multiple times, shine through and give it lasting re-read incentive.”

Available are hardcover later editions, signed by Pat.  Sorry, no personalizations are available on these items.

Each copy comes with its own “This Shit Is Not For Kids” promotional sticker.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: The Legend of Neil (The Complete Series) on DVD
description: Settle in for a geeky good time with the complete series of The Legend of Neil on DVD! About The Legend of Neil: "Beer-guzzling slacker Neil Grimsley accidentally finds a code that sucks him into the fantasy video game The Legend of Zelda. Neil is immediately charged with the task of defeating the evil Lord Gannon and saving Princess Zelda, armed with nothing but a shoddy wooden sword and a gigantic hangover. "Created and directed by Sandeep Parikh (The Guild, Community, SyFy's Viral Video Showdown), The Legend of Neil follows our reluctant hero (Tony Janning, Machinima's Prank Lab, Roddenberry's WhiteRoom: 02B3) as he traverses the world of Hyrule, encountering sarcastic wizard mentors (Mike Rose, The Guild), sex-starved fairies (Felicia Day, (The Guild, Dr. Horrible's Sing-A-long Blog), half-horse dance crews (Rober Hoffman, Step Up 2), whiny giants (comedians The Sklar Brothers) and much more!" This unratred two-disk DVD contains all three seasons, plus some never before seen behind-the-scenes awesomeness. And if that wasn't awesome enough, we also have some signed copies! The illustrious signatures include creator/director/writer Sandeep Parikh, writer/actor Tony Janning, and actress Felicia Day. If you think this is a must-have, you should probably check out our Legend of Neil Combination Pack! All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: The Eolian Bar T-shirt
description: A delightfully stealth-geek logo on a black t-shirt. This shirt cures all known illnesses and makes you roughly 38% more attractive. Available in Men's and Women's sizes. A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Kingkiller T-shirt
description: Grey t-shirt with the Kingkiller Graphic. It's available in Men's and Women's sizes. A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Alternate Color Kingkiller Shirt
description: Light grey t-shirt with the Kingkiller Graphic - a variation on our standard grey Kingkiller shirt (shown in the background for color comparison). This is a special limited item, and only available in Men's sizing - once they're gone, they're gone! A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Names Compilation T-shirt
description: I really don't know what to write here. It's fairly self-explanatory. This is a t-shirt with this design on it. White on black. It's available in Men's and Women's sizes. A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Name of the Wind Infant Bodysuit
description:
Geek infant bodysuits! 

These white cotton bodysuits will enhance the charm and cuteness of your baby and cause bystanders to make high pitched noises of devotion when they see your baby. 

We have several sizes in stock:  newborn, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months, and 24 months.

Sizing reference: the item Mr. Baby is wearing is a size newborn, though he's growing fast (at 15 pounds!) and would probably do best in a 3 months.  The suit our young toddler Oot is wearing is 24 months. And as you can see, it's too big for him. He's about 27 pounds, and the 18 month one fits him much better.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Beatrice's Goat & The Name of the Wind Infant Bodysuit Combination Pack
description: “If you were to visit the small African village of Kisinga in the rolling hills of western Uganda, and if you were to take a left at the crossroads and follow a dirt path between two tall banana groves, you would come to the home of a girl named Beatrice.” So begins the tale of a young girl and her wonderful goat, Musiga. This limited-edition Combination Pack pairs author Page McBrier's lovely book, Beatrice's Goat, with our Name of the Wind Infant Bodysuit, guaranteed to enhance the charm and cuteness of your baby and cause bystanders to make high pitched noises of joy and devotion. We have several sizes in stock: newborn, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months, and 24 months. This set makes a great gift for the new parents in your life! Want to hear more about Beatrice? You can watch author and Heifer supporter Patrick Rothfuss read Beatrice's Goat here. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Worldbuilders T-shirt
description: The Worldbuilders logo on a forest green t-shirt. All proceeds go to - you guessed it - Worldbuilders! Available in Unisex sizes. A sizing chart can be found on our FAQ. *Alas, folks, we're discontinuing this item, so when they're gone, they're gone...

name: Denna's Ring
description:
The design for Denna's Ring was created by Badali Jewelry in cooperation with Patrick Rothfuss. The ring is described as silver set with a pale blue stone, though Kvothe later learns that the metal is white gold, and the gem is a smokestone™. The ring is one of the few things Denna has a sentimental attachment to, and she has a nervous habit of twirling it on her finger. Denna's Ring first appears in The Name of the Wind™ and serves as a plot point in The Wise Man's Fear™.

Denna's Ring holds a smokestone, represented by a genuine blue topaz, and the ring itself is made of sterling silver.  It comes with a card of authenticity.

Please note that all our rings are in US sizes.  They are available in a plain or antiqued finish.

These rings were made by Badali Jewelry.  Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Eolian Talent Pipes Necklace
description: Badali Jewelry and Patrick Rothfuss collaborated to replicate the talent pipes awarded to talented musicians at the Eolian. Pipes are made of sterling silver, and are available in plain silver or with black antiquing. Comes on a 24" long rhodium plated chain, and in a nifty little black box and with a card of authenticity. Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds. All proceeds go to

name: Antler Bone Ring
description: These rings were made from antlers shed from white tail deer, and were handcrafted by Japheth of Trinkets and Tinkering. Complete with natural coloration, flaws, and marrow spots, each ring has its own interesting and distinctly one-of-a-kind pattern and texture. They come in a faux leather ring box. These rings are made from natural materials, and therefore are subject to varied flaws and colorations. Unfortunately, we are unable to take requests for a specific texture or color (e.g. flawed or smooth, white or grey). Discover more amazing work by this talented artist on his Facebook page. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Cocobolo Wood Ring
description: This ring made of Cocobolo wood was handcrafted by Japheth of Trinkets and Tinkering. Its beautiful wood grain boasts a warm reddish tint that contrasts with rich, darker stripes. It comes in a faux leather ring box. These rings are made from natural materials, and therefore are subject to varied wood grain and color. Unfortunately, we are unable to take requests for specific colors (e.g. lighter or darker). Please be forewarned that submersion in water (via the washing machine, hand-washing dishes, etc.) will weaken the integrity of your ring and may cause it to break. Discover more amazing work by this talented artist on his Facebook page. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Zebrawood Ring
description: This ring made of Zebrawood was handcrafted by Japheth of Trinkets and Tinkering. Blonde striped with dark defines this wood's gorgeous grain, and gives it its name. It comes in a faux leather ring box. These rings are made from natural materials, and therefore are subject to varied wood grain and color. Unfortunately, we are unable to take requests for specific colors (e.g. lighter or darker). Please be forewarned that submersion in water (via the washing machine, hand-washing dishes, etc.) will weaken the integrity of your ring and may cause it to break. Discover more amazing work by this talented artist on his Facebook page. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Tehlu's Iron Wheel Pendant
description:
Badali Jewelry and Patrick Rothfuss collaborated to replicate the iron wheel pendant worn by Tehlan priests, marked with the names of the seven angels of Tehlu.

The wheel is made of iron, and is available on a silver chain or on a brown leather cord.  It comes in a burgundy drawstring pouch and with a card of authenticity.

Visit www.badalijewelry.com to see more amazing jewelry from all over the fantasy worlds.

All proceeds to go Worldbuilders.

name: 2013 Fantasy Pin-Up Calendar
description:
For a limited time, the 2013 Fantasy Pin-up Calendar is on sale for 50% off!  (Limited Edition 2013 Fantasy Pin-up Calendar not included.)

***

For our 2013 calendar, we've teamed up with some of the best authors in the fantasy genre: Peter S. Beagle, Ray Bradbury, Patricia Briggs, Jim Butcher, Jacqueline Carey, Neil Gaiman, Charlaine Harris, Robin Hobb, N.K. Jemisin, George R. R. Martin, Terry Pratchett, and Patrick Rothfuss.

Illustrated by Lee Moyer (www.leemoyer.com), each month of the calendar will feature a different author, detailing one of their characters, or offering an homage to their work. 

All proceeds from the project go to Worldbuilders in support of Heifer International.

options.name: Numbered Limited Edition: Signed by Artist Lee Moyer

name: Amyr Poster
description:
Drawn by the awesome Nathan Taylor, this black and white 11" by 14" poster depicts one of the Amyr in all his formidable power.  It's printed on heavy-duty paper.

The poster is available in its virginal state or bedecked with Pat Rothfuss' signature.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Luring the Draccus Poster
description:
Created by artist Phil McDarby, this 24" by 18" matte finish poster is based on The Name of the Wind.  

Description from Phil's website:

"This image was a kind of self-imposed challenge – I totally fell in love with an incredible book called The Name Of The Wind by Patrick Rothfuss, and as a tribute, I wanted to try and recreate a scene from the book. Usually my images evolve as I work on them, often ending up only vaguely resembling the original idea, but with this, I set myself a very specific brief – Pat’s amazing words – and set about trying to make it real. "

www.philmcdarby.com

We do have some glossy finish, slightly bruised posters, as well.  The image is fine.  They're just a little scuffed on the edges from travel.  They are listed at a reduced price.

Your poster can be signed by Pat if you wish.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: O Medo do Homem Sabio Poster
description:
This special edition poster was created by Gailivro as a promotion for the release of The Wise Man's Fear in Portugal. 
 
They've graciously allowed us to reprint some copies and sell them for Worldbuilders. 

They're 24"X18" and printed on nice, high quality paper. We went to pros to get them done, this isn't some Kinkos job... 
 
Pat will either write his name on these, or leave them pristine and unblemished, depending on which you prefer.... 

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Four Corners Map
description:
Drawn by my friend, Nathan Taylor. Nate also drew the black and white map that ended up in The Name of the Wind. 

This is the color version of the map, so you can see some of the detail that’s not available in the book, including some of the political borders.

Poster is roughly 17" by 11" and printed on heavy-duty paper. 

If you like, Pat Rothfuss will deface the poster with his signature. If you don't like, he'll leave it alone and deliver it to you in a pristine condition. 

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Kvothe Giclees
description:
This is the original artwork for the first Name of the Wind bookcover.

Limited edition, signed by the artist. 13 by 17" giclee. (Giclees are remarkably similar to continuous tone lithography and provide the most faithful representation of the original artwork.)

Printed on Hahnemuhle 308 g/m2 100% Cotton Rag acid free archival stock. 

www.donatoart.com

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Mr. Whiffle and Ms. Moo Poster
description:
A poster for those of you that enjoyed the dark humor of The Adventures of the Princess and Mr. Whiffle: The Thing Beneath the Bed. 

This poster celebrates what I think of as the Mr. Whiffle and Ms. Moo subplot of the book. 

Poster is roughly 17" by 11" and printed on heavy-duty paper. It also includes one of the gold foil Mr. Whiffle stickers.

Signed by Patrick Rothfuss. 

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Big, Bad Wolf (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: A crimson-cloaked young lady with a basket full of geeky goodies is tempted off the forest path. We've got two versions of this print available, the Green/Brown version (on the left), and the Blue/Red version (on the right). Please select the version you'd like from the drop down menu when adding to your cart. Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

options.name: Brown/Green Version - Signed & dated by the artist
Blue/Red Version - Signed & Dated by the artist

name: Steampunk Tink Nouveau (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This brassy fairy is all geared up to hang on your wall! Printed on 8" x 12" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Stowaway (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This bright-winged little lady is destined for the second star to the right...and from there, Who knows! Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2013 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Who's This? (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: A curious skeleton is only a threshold away from seriously broadening his event horizons. Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Visions are Seldom What They Seem (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This young beauty is ready to skip her naptime and rescue herself from a boring afternoon. Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2013 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Touch the Stars...and Then the Sky (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This bold young woman's hunt for an exciting destiny is about to get, well, more exciting... Printed on 8" x 12" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Part of Every World (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This inquisitive mermaid can call off her search for an adventure full of new experiences and novelties...if she can find her voice. Printed on 8" x 10" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Adventure in the Great Wide Somewhere (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: We're sure that this book lover and her mysterious new companion are seeking the biggest library time and space have ever known...and it's the only library that features a swimming pool. Printed on 8" x 10" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. We have a few slightly bruised prints available at a reduced price. These items have slight bends in the corners - framing should hide these little imperfections! All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Strawberry Girl (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: Our favorite carefree space mechanic has a whole box full of a precious sort of loot... Shiny! Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: Cunning and Blue (Print by Karen Hallion)
description: This imaginative and devious little - ahem - "canine" just became a more cunning fellow, don't you think? Printed on 8" x 8" photo paper, this beautiful art was originally done by Karen Hallion. The back of the print is signed and dated with the year. The words "Copyright 2010 Karen Hallion Illustrations" do not appear on the actual print. Check out more of Karen's amazing artwork on her Etsy store. All proceeds got to Worldbuilders.

name: The Legend of Neil Combination Pack
description: It's dangerous to go alone! Take this! Our Legend of Neil Combination Pack offers the best deal yet - a signed or unsigned copy of The Legend of Neil (The Complete Series) on DVD, plus The Legend of Neil (The Last Season) poster, and at a slightly discounted price! You can find more information about the the DVD and the poster, or buy them individually, here: -The Legend of Neil (The Complete Series) on DVD -The Legend of Neil (The Last Season) Poster The posters included in this Combination Pack were donated by the Parikh brothers. Please note that the poster and DVD will ship in separate packages. Because the DVD won't roll into a tube, and you don't want us to fold your poster into a box. (Really, you don't.) All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: The Legend of Neil (The Last Season) Poster
description: Wave your geek flag (or, heck, frame it and hang it on the wall!) with this 18" x 24" poster. Created by Atom.com, this glossy poster will be a continual reminder that it's dangerous to go alone! If you think this is great, you should check out our Legend of Neil Combination Pack! These posters were generously donated by the Parikh brothers. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Beatrice's Goat by Page McBrier, Illustrated by Lori Lohstoeter (US Edition)
description: This beautiful hardcover children's book is a great example of all the work that Heifer International, a global nonprofit, is doing. These books are thrice-signed, and in limited supply. The author, Page McBrier, the illustrator, Lori Lohstoeter, and Beatrice, the subject of the book, have all graced these books with their signatures. You're not going to be able to find a copy of this book signed like this anywhere else. We were lucky to catch Beatrice and get these books signed by her while she was visiting Heifer International’s headquarters, which is something that she doesn’t get to do often. Publishers Weekly had this to say about Beatrice's Goat: "McBrier's tale, inspired by actual events, succeeds in demonstrating the positive ripple effect of the efforts of one organization. [...] Perhaps the volume's greatest strength is Lohstoeter's (How the Leopard Got His Spots) sunny acrylic paintings, which capture the hues of dusty thatched huts and verdant banana groves of the African landscape. Sweet-faced Beatrice and her mother take center stage, wearing colorful, traditional clothes, and their bond is palpable." All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

options.name: Signed by Page, Lori, and Beatrice

name: The Daylight War by Peter V. Brett (US Edition)
description: This is a first edition hardcover of The Daylight War, the highly anticipated third book in Peter V. Brett's series The Demon Cycle. Amanda and Nate drove to Minneapolis to have Peter V. Brett sign these books for you. They returned claiming he smelled of cinnamon, and had a strong baritone voice. He signed quickly, yet passionately, happy to spread some cheer through The Tinker's Packs. (Sorry, personalizations are not available, as we didn't kidnap Mr. Brett.) All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Troubletwisters: The Magic by Garth Nix and Sean Williams (US Edition)
description: The Magic, book one in the Troubletwisters series by Garth Nix and Sean Williams, is an "enjoyable romp [that should] prove satisfying to a wide range of middle school readers." (Publisher's Weekly) It's available here in paperback, and is signed by both of the authors. We have a limited number of copies, so get yours now! About the book: "Are you a troubletwister? Jaide and Jack Shield's lives are changing in a very, very strange way. The weather is turning against them. Magical disasters occur when they're around. And a mysterious explosion has just destroyed their house...from the inside. Without knowing why, the twins are stolen away to live with Grandma X--a relative they've never, ever met. At Grandma X's house, things are even stranger. Weather vanes point in the opposite direction of the wind. Doors appear and disappear. Cats talk. Jaide and Jack don't know the reason behind all this strangeness. They don't know that they're troubletwisters, and that they must defend the world against a dark, evil force. The time has come for them to discover the truth--and the powers that come with the truth. Are they ready?" These books were donated by Sean Williams. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Bilge Adamın Korkusu
description: The Turkish translation of The Wise Man’s Fear. We have some books that were slightly scuffed on the trip over from Turkey so we are selling them discounted. Pat will sign and personalize your book however you like. That said, please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

That said, please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Las Aventuras de la Princesa y el Señor Fu - Spanish Edition
description: This is the Spanish Hardcover Edition of The Adventures of the Princess and Mr. Whiffle, Patrick Rothfuss's twisted not-for-kids picture book. Patrick Rothfuss describes this book as "a dark twist on the classic children's picture-book. I think of it as Calvin and Hobbes meets Coraline, with some Edward Gorey mixed in." From the San Francisco Book Review: “In what is by far the funniest and most original book of the year (so far), Rothfuss shows off his ability to think and create outside of the expected. The story is pure comic genius that will be fun and funny for parents and children. The illustrations, not to be outdone, offer subtle little quirks that, after reading the book multiple times, shine through and give it lasting re-read incentive.” Available are hardcover first editions, with the option to have yours signed and personalized by Pat. If you choose personalization, please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. Each copy comes with its own “This Shit Is Not For Kids” promotional sticker. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

If you'd like that special touch on these limited items, Pat will personalize your book however you like. Please see our FAQ for personalization guidelines. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

description: These are the Indonesian editions of Dealing with Dragons and Searching for Dragons, books 1 and 2 of The Enchanted Forest Chronicles by Patricia C. Wrede. In August, 2012, The Enchanted Forest Chronices were named to the top one hundred in NPR Books's Best-Ever Teen Fiction list. Books 1 and 2 are offered here as a set, in paperback. Both books were signed and donated by the author. All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

description:

All three books have been signed, and were donated by the author.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

The book is signed, and was donated by the author.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

This is the Czech edition of <i>In Legend Born<i/>, book one of <i>The Chronicles of Sirkara<i/> series by Laura Resnick.  It was split into two volumes by the publisher, and they are available here as a set in paperback.

Both books were signed and donated by the author.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Ангел с часовников механизъм by Cassandra Clare
description:
This is the Bulgarian edition of Clockwork Angel, book one of The Infernal Devices Series, by Cassandra Clare.  It was signed and donated by the author, and comes with a promotional bookmark.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Sleeping Queens
description:
This fast-paced game full of family fun will have you scrambling to wake the most queens as quickly as you can! Use Knights to steal Queens from your opponents, Dragons to defend against Knights, and potions to put another player's Queens back to sleep.  This game's simple and straightforward rules ensure a level playing field for everyone, and the quick game play makes for a <i>rousing<i/> good time!

Sleeping Queens was invented by a six-year-old girl one night when she couldn't sleep.  It's noted for numerous accomplishments, including receiving the National Parenting Center Seal of Approval and the highest rating from the Canadian Toy Testing Council.

This game, manufactured by Gamewright, encourages strategy and memory development, and reinforces elementary math skills.

Players: 2-5
Age: 8 & up
Length: 20 minutes

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Cthulhu Playing Cards
description: The Call of Cthulhu playing card deck is printed by the famous United States Playing Card Company with a full 56 custom poker-sized cards. Featuring intricate and horrific illustrations by Shane Tyree, all brought to you by Albino Dragon. The stars are right. Available are three options: -the standard edition (red back), -the limited edition (green back), -the limited edition (green back), signed by the artist, Shane Tyree. Please note that the limited edition decks with the green back (signed and unsigned) are indeed a limited edition, and when they're gone, they're gone... All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

name: Mr. Whiffle Stickers
description:
A surprising number of people have asked if they could get hold of some of the gold foil promotional stickers we made up for the Adventures of the Princess and Mr. Whiffle. 

Since we aim to please, we're putting the extra stickers on sale here. They're three for a buck. Supplies are limited. 

Shipping is free on these so long as you're buying something else. 

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.
